I refer especially to large Heavy Goods Vehicles who seemingly take perhaps 5-10 miles to overtake 'slow' vehicles on the nations motorway network. 
They will become frustrated by the vehicle they are following in the slow lane, then move to the middle lane to overtake... 
However, their bulk and mass means that they only travel approx. 1-2 miles per hour quicker than the vehicles they are overtaking. This means that for one HGV to overtake another can perhaps take the time required to circumnavigate the M25. This of course has a knock on effect. It means that 'white-van' men are forced to the fast lane to overtake themselves. But again, the mass of their vehicles, often in questionable mechanical order mean that they too take quite some time to overtake. This in turn causes further 'ripples', with a convoy of executive saloons (generally Audi's, Mercedes and BMW's with the occasional Ford and Vauxhall mixed in) and 'white-van' men all forced into the (now slower) fast lane. Generally speaking, a massive traffic jam has been caused, all because of a middle lane hog. 
What impact does this have on GDP? How much national output is waisted thanks to the middle-lane hogs? How much fuel is unnecessarily burned when 'cruising' speeds are interrupted by the sudden traffic jams that occur because of these middle lane hogs? How much extra wear and tear is created on the nations vehicles because of it?
